column4: I added my current user to the ntfs group using the command "usermode -G ntfs" and now there is no sound, can anyone help please?
presumably you mean usermod, not usermode
yes sorry :)
hard to see how that could cause the sound problem.  with the upper case G it adds you to a new group but does not remove you from any groups, and does not change the default group
I suspect that losing sound at that point is a coincidence and caused by something else.
is there a way I can figure out what happened, I was trying to configure ntfs-fuse, this one made my ntfs disk icons not show on desktop anymore, and the sound to be disabled
It may be as you said, but how can I fix it...? how do I investigate?
is sound completely dead?  can you play a .wav file with the aplay utility?
there was sound before I logged in, sound is completely dead now
aplay give error such as no soundcard found
it says No volume control GStreamer plugins and/or devices found. when I double click on the sound icon
normally by stopping synaptic
do ps aux | grep synaptic    make sure you don't have one running that you don't know about
also make sure apt-get and/or dpkg also is not running
jazzrocker,  ps -aux | grep  apt returns nothing
actually, no, grep -i atp would
the other thing that causes the "can't lock" message is if you don't run as root.   try the command again, but with sudo
l, linux froze and I had to reboot
when I launch synaptic I am prompted to enter my password
you do   sudo synaptic?
yes synaptic requires me to run it using sudo
ok, let's finish, you type a password (your password, not root's password, correct?), and then?
ok got the problem, as I said it's because I had to shut down while synaptic was running, to fix: dpkg --configure -a (if anyone else needs it) thanks all,  sethk, nozorro, jazzrocker, lamego
thanks
